poem:
### Labour's Lament

In harrowed fields of work,  
the seed of justice lies.  
Yet what harvest comes  
without the tiller's hands,  
without wind's resolve?  
The spoke turns slowly  
in the machine of time,  
rusted by neglect—  
power's unseen cruelty  
withers hopes once sown  
under a faint bureaucratic sun.
